email.title: Weekly Digest
email.text:
Hi everyone,
Now that we have settled well into second term, we hope you're all coping with your coursework. Although, we kept it silent this week (post IC Hack rest), we are coming back with more events than ever for you!\ Besides, the hackathons and workshops that we run in February, we added some social events for next week, so you can take a moment to relax from all the universitycd .. work. Reading groups are also back! Also, we will be selling our second batch of tickets for Revel (first batch sold out in less than 15 seconds!) on **Monday 17th at 1:30**.
Read on for more information!
email.heading: Run for DoCSoc's 2020/21 Committee
email.text:
**Leadership Elections 2020** are now open and nominations are now open for DoCSoc's 2020/21 committee. Nominations will run **until 12:00 on Friday 28th February**.
We will be running a short presentation this Thursday detailing the responsibilities of every role and other information you should know when running for a committee position(details below). We strongly recommend you attend the event, if you are planning on standing for a role within DoCSoc.
If you have any questions, please feel free to reach out to us at docsoc@imperial.ac.uk or get in touch with a current committee member!
email.heading: Leon x DesSoc Hackathon

event.text:
Join the us on Saturday 22nd and Sunday the 23rd of February for an exciting weekend of hacking and hands-on prototyping. All teams will present their work at an event in the evening on Monday the 24th of February to the Leon CEO and team. The event welcomes all students enthusiastic about sustainability, future technologies (including robotics) and UX/UI design and engineering.
This event is sponsored by Leon and will be hosted at their HQ in Southwark.

email.heading: Games Night with G-Research

event.text:
Please click GOING if you're likely to attend so we can order enough pizza üçïüçïüçï
---
Ever wondered what is it like to work at G-Research, or what G-Research does anyway? Come to our casual Games Night on Monday 17th February to play some of our favourite board games and have a chat. We are hiring and would love to answer any question/worry that you have when it comes to applying. We also love to just have a fun time with you too.
Free pizzas and drinks are available. Be sure to beat our Head of Engineering on his favourite board games!

email.heading: Raspberry Pi Workshops

event.text:
Have you ever wanted to know more about a Raspberry Pi? Or are you a first year Computing student whose summer project will closely involve the Raspberry Pi? Then come join us at our new 4-week Raspberry Pi course where you will get to learn what this small computer is capable of!
We will introduce the Pi, its architecture and do multiple demos for VNC Connections, Python + Assembly programming and coding a tiny bootloader!
These workshops are open to everyone! Make sure to grab your Eventbrite ticket to get free pizza!

email.heading: Reading Groups by Prof Abbas Edalat and Antonio Rago

event.text:
Reading groups are back this term! Reading groups are sessions where researchers come and talk about their current work to expose current undergraduate students to research! These talks are open to everyone!
Session 1 by Prof Abbas Edalat at 1-1.30 pm Title Algorithmic Human Development: What is it and why do we need it now?
Abstract In the face of our current existential problems and challenges, I will argue by making a comparison with the origin of AI that we now actually need to develop algorithms to enhance emotional and social intelligence and creativity in the human individual. These non-invasive protocols would be based on neuroplasticity and long term potentiation and represent an interactive play between two internal agents: the emotion-driven Child and the thought-driven Adult equipped with an action programme. The protocols aim at neural retraining for optimal redevelopment and emotion self-regulation in the individual regarded as a biological cybernetic system with the targeted goals of becoming (i) compassionate, (ii) cheerful and (iii) creative. Our proposed framework, named Self-attachment, has parallels with Machine Learning as it employs the the basic paradigms of "rebooting", "substitution", "iteration" and "prior updating" in the human individual. I will give the results of a pilot project on the subject and describe two Bayesian computational brain models for it: one based on Hebbian artificial neural networks and one on the Free Energy Principle. I will finally argue that learning to laugh, in particular to laugh at oneself, is the number one learning task in our age and present novel protocols, based on logical theories of laughter, to explain how this learning can be acquired.
Session 2 by Antonio Rago at 1.30-2 pm Title Argumentation as a Framework for Conversational AI
Abstract As AI becomes ever more ubiquitous in our everyday lives, its ability to explain to and interact with humans is evolving into a critical research area. The explanation of a result, e.g. a prediction or a recommendation, in a way which allows a user to anthropomorphise a system is, therefore, a pivotal functionality in a user‚Äôs experience. We show how argumentative abstractions underpinning AI methods can provide the structural scaffolding for conversational explanations. We illustrate how the dialectical reasoning and conflict management capabilities of argumentation empower conversational repertoires in two different settings, recommender systems and automated review aggregation. We then demonstrate how the resulting explanations may be equipped with feedback mechanisms that guarantee that the system‚Äôs accuracy will improve with time or may simply be designed to induce trust in and provide transparency to users.

email.heading: So you want to run for DoCSoc Committee?

event.text:
Thinking of running for DoCSoc committee in this year's Leadership Elections? Come along to this talk, presented by current members of the committee, where we'll be detailing what exactly goes into DoCSoc and what each role entails.
Read more about the Leadership Elections here: https://www.imperialcollegeunion.org/your-union/leadership-elections-2020
Nominate yourself here: https://vote.union.ic.ac.uk/
Don't forget to read the Candidates' Pack & Election Rules: https://www.imperialcollegeunion.org/information-for-candidates#Candidates%20Pack. Breaking election rules can result in disqualification.
See you there!

email.heading: Google Hashcode Imperial College London Hub

event.text:
Hash Code is a team programming competition, organized by Google, for students and professionals around the world. You pick your team and programming language and we pick an engineering problem for you to solve. Join us at the Imperial College London Hub for the Online Qualification Round. Top teams will then be invited to a Google office for the Final Round.
Sign up here: https://g.co/hashcode Remember to select Imperial College London Hub after you apply
There are only 100 slots for our hub, so make sure you sign up as soon as possible

email.heading: The Valentine's Bar Night

event.text:
You've made it halfway through term - come celebrate with us at the Valentine's Bar Night! Whether you've been bitten by the love bug or you're living life carefree, everyone's welcome for some free drinks.
Drinks tokens will be given upon entry for FREE to DoCSoc members. Tokens are valid for both alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks. We have the right to refuse tokens to members at our discretion.
You are entitled to bring one non-Imperial plus one. ID must be shown at entry to prove this. You must stay with your plus one at all times and they will not be given any drinks tokens. Imperial plus ones must be DoCSoc members in order to attend.
We may decide to head to Belushi's after the event; if this is the case, DoCSoc often buys attendees a round of drinks, so if you're unable to come to the bar night, bear in mind there is still a chance members will go out after!
----------------------
You must be a member of DoCSoc before Saturday 15th February in order to be admitted. Computing, JMC, and EIE students are automatically members of DoCSoc. Membership is ¬£30. Strictly 18+ only - we will be checking IDs.
Please send an email to us at docsoc@ic.ac.uk if you intend to bring a non-Imperial plus one. Any Imperial plus-ones must have purchased membership, otherwise they will be denied entry.
Our full barnight policy is linked here: http://docsoc.co.uk/barnightpolicy
Find out more: http://docsoc.co.uk/join

email.heading: Ed Tech Hackday

event.text:
Join DoC on Saturday 22nd February for a one day Hackathon to help design and develop to your education tools (Materials, eMarking and more)
This is an excellent occasion for people interested in working on the Edtech platforms with us over the summer to start exploring the code and make a first contribution
Please RSVP here: https://forms.gle/foZwZKEN6XVrNVr68
Lunch will be provided on the day, so let us know if you plan to attend by selecting "Going" and filling in the form above!

email.heading: IC HealthHack 2020

event.text:
The Department of Computing Society (DoCSoc), Bioengineering Society, ICSM Coding Society and MedTech Society proudly present the IC HealthHack 2020!
We are back with HealthHack 20 bigger and better than ever! Combining skills in bioengineering, computer science, and medicine, HealthHack will bring together talented students to tackle the most current medical challenges through technology. This year, we are focusing on Medical Education as our overarching theme. Over the weekend of 29th February - 1st March 2020, teams will bring their awesome ideas to life and develop solutions to real-life health education challenges.
Save the date and follow the event page for more details, including sponsors and schedule announcements.
Website: https://ichealthhack.org/

email.heading: Roaring Revel: Second Batch of Tickets

event.text:
**This event is for 18+ only.**
A little party never killed nobody, so join RCSU and DoCSoc for an extravagant night of glitz, glam and a party fit for the 20's - here's to Roaring Revel!
From Spanish rooftop bars to Parisian themed halls, we're now taking you back in time to the Prohibition era. Our chosen gin mill, Quaglino's, is decorated to the taste of the period and has a history as rich as the location of St James's.
The evening will start with a cocktail reception with further drinks served later as the night progresses. We will also be serving canap√©s and providing entertainment throughout the evening. So wear your ritziest garms and get ready to party like it's the 20's!
Ticket prices:
DoCSoc: ¬£28
RCSU: ¬£35
**Second batch releases on 17th February: 1:30pm!**

email.heading: Next Jump is hiring ‚Äì Deadline next week!
email.sponsor:
**Who are we?**\ Next Jump is a global tech company with an award-winning culture. We help to transform companies from all sectors (Finance, Tech, Military) to build high performing teams; and our E-commerce platform is used by 70% of the Fortune 1000 (including Facebook, Bloomberg and the BBC) making $2B in sales a year. Over the last 12 months, our core and social businesses have been growing rapidly. We are looking for developers who want to design, build and market amazing mobile apps and web platforms - built with React Native, Go, PHP, Vue.js, AWS and more - to our 3 million UK customers from their first day on the job.
The deadline for our Spring Super Saturday is **Friday, 21st February** - catch our interest and we'll chat to you, send you a coding test and invite you to our Super Saturday assessment day on the 29th Feb 2020.
We are looking to fill the vacancies in our Intern Class 2020 as well as Graduate Class 2020.
**Apply Now!** If you are looking for a 'not-your-typical graduate job/internship', then Next Jump's the place for you! - Graduate Class 2020: https://nextjump.applytojob.com/apply/UWulrrsRCG/Software-Engineer-Web-Applications - Intern Class 2020: https://nextjump.applytojob.com/apply/wYfZzpCivx/Software-Engineer-Web-Applications-Internship
email.heading: Bloomberg Industrial Placement & Graduate Positions
email.sponsor:
Bloomberg's applications for the [Industrial Placements](https://careers.bloomberg.com/job/detail/76941) and [Graduate Positions](https://careers.bloomberg.com/job/detail/76939) are open.
Bloomberg's diverse community of engineers take on some of the world‚Äôs most interesting and important technical challenges. We develop impactful solutions to complex, real-world problems. With new systems being rolled out daily, we make an immediate impact on global markets and we look for the best software engineers to build them.
